name: Dawn of the Damned
description:
Anxious to attend your job interview at Aurora Antiques, you arrive to discover a room full of melancholy mannequins. One, in particular, captures your interest, drawing you closer.
"Beautiful, isn't she? I can tell you her tale if you like."
"It all started with a selfish wish..."








- 14 original CGs to unlock -
(24 including variations)

- Full voice acting -

- Atmospheric audio -
(designed for head/earphones)

- OST -
(with 20 original BGM tracks)

- Approximately 12k words -

- 3 different endings -

- Unlockable extras section -
(with bonus sketches, music box, and bloopers)

Please note that this game contains the following content warnings:

- Blood -

- Injury Detail -

- Threatening Behaviour -

- Bad Language -

- Cannibalism - 

- Medication & Medical Equipment - 
(syringes, scalpels)

Need a walkthrough for the game to unlock all the CGs and reach all the endings? Head here!

Found a nasty bug that needs squashing? Head here to report it!

Or need help with opening the game on Mac? Head here for a list of suggestions from fellow players who have managed to get my games to open on Mac in the past.

The game is designed to be played in 16:9 1920x1080. When playing in any other resolution, the UI may appear somewhat out of place + parts of the image will be cut off. If you are playing in anything other than 16:9 or 16:10, during one particular scene, you will not be able to click on 3 objects to examine them (as the resolution will mean they are cut off of the edge of the screen). 1 of those objects unlocks a CG.

Please note that the game was designed to be played with head/earphones on and all audio turned on. Some of the SFX are timed with the voice acting, so if you change the text reveal speed or skip through text, SFX may play slightly out of time.

- Controls -

Advance Text - Left mouse click, mouse scroll wheel down, spacebar 

Rewind Text - Mouse scroll wheel up, left arrow key 
(text cannot be rewound after making a choice, so please save the game if you want to pick a different choice faster)

Skip Mode (fast) - Up arrow key

Skip Mode (toggle) - Right arrow key 

Auto Mode - Down arrow key

 Open Backlog - B key 

Toggle/Hide UI - H key

If you need help with anything, enjoyed the game and want to talk about it, or just want to tell me something in general, please either use the comments section (and don't forget to rate and review the game too if you had fun because it helps a lot :3) or feel free to message me here:
melancholicmarionette@gmail.com

Dawn of the Damned is a spinoff/standalone backstory that will eventually be related to one of my main projects, Darling Duality. At some point in the future, I hope to add both Morgenröte and Dämmerung to DD as love interests. However, you won't need to play Dawn of the Damned to understand the characters when they're actually added to DD. This will simply serve as a standalone story that will hopefully just add to the enjoyment of both projects if you do decide to play them both :3
